revision:
Trignometric ratios of some specific angles

  1. sin(0\(^\circ\))=\(0\), sin(30\(^\circ\))=\(\frac 12\), sin(45\(^\circ\))=\(1\over \sqrt 2\), sin(60\(^\circ\))=\(\sqrt 3\over 2\), sin(90\(^\circ\))=\(1\)
  2. cos(0\(^\circ\))=\(1\), cos(30\(^\circ\))=\(\sqrt 3\over 2\), cos(45\(^\circ\))=\(1\over \sqrt 2\), cos(60\(^\circ\))=\(\frac 12\), cos(90\(^\circ\))=\(0\)
  3. tan(0\(^\circ\))=\(0\), tan(30\(^\circ\))=\(1\over \sqrt 3\), tan(45\(^\circ\))=\(1\), tan(60\(^\circ\))=\(\sqrt 3\), tan(90\(^\circ\))=\(not\,defined\)
  4. cosec \(\theta\), sec \(\theta\) , cot \(\theta\) can be determined by \(1\over sin \theta \), \(1\over cos \theta \), \(1\over tan \theta\) respectively.
  5. From the above points we can observe that as \(\angle\) \(\theta\) increases from 0\(^\circ\) to 90\(^\circ\), sin \(\theta\) increases from 0 to 1 and cos \(\theta\) decreases from 1 to 0.
